name: untranslatable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
impossible to translate (= change into a different language): Their relationship is a perfect example of the role of "guanxi", that untranslatable Chinese term for those all-important personal connections. The songs are usually about "saudade", a virtually untranslatable word meaning a mixture of fondness and nostalgia. Related word
untranslatability
More examplesFewer examplesThe play has an almost untranslatable title that roughly corresponds to "lazy layabouts".The Glaswegian word "gallus" is untranslatable, but "mischievously daring" comes close.He invented a very peculiar literary style and a unique and untranslatable language of his own.
